messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: New England Live & Learn Conference
messages.msgSnippet: I think you ll have a good time. Peabody is very near Boston, Salem, etc. Without too much drama, you can get public transportation into Boston so you don t
messages.messageBody:
I think you'll have a good time. Peabody is very near Boston, Salem, etc.
Without too much drama, you can get public transportation into Boston so you
don't have drive there, and it's a lot less expensive than staying in the city.
And if you want, you can get into Southern Maine in less than two hours.

Kathryn

I am so excited about this. I grew up in Back Bay in Boston, and in Newton. We went to the North Shore a few times but never to your area. I always wanted to go there. Plus, we never want to spend the money to go back to MA but now we have a great excuse. I think dh has also known that if we go back up, I won't want to leave. It's prob. a good thing the conference isn't happening in the fall.

Madeline

messages.subject: Re: New England Live & Learn Conference

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/2/2003 11:42:09 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

> WOOHOO! I am trying to plan to stay longer or come in early. Now it's a
> clencher with it being right around my birthday. <sg> I've wanted to take
> the boys to see some of the sights in that area for the longest time. I've
> never been so it will be a treat for us all. Thanks Kathryn for all you're
> doing to get this going. Kelly's done a wonderful job in SC and I know
> you'll get it together and it will be great too. :-)
>
>

I think you'll have a good time. Peabody is very near Boston, Salem, etc.
Without too much drama, you can get public transportation into Boston so you
don't have drive there, and it's a lot less expensive than staying in the city.
And if you want, you can get into Southern Maine in less than two hours.

Kathryn
